content: These need to be taken for what they are — “fun craft practice.” Practice of tools or reconstructing something to understand details of what was created, while escaping the hurdles of reality. Back in university we went through tracing logos, type, layouts and websites, exactly for the same reason. As students we gained clarity through practice. Impact of data science is stripping the love of craft in the day to day practice, figuratively gutting the gut many of us grew to depend on. Designers in self defense then built a pedestal to celebrate the pure visual appeal of our profession. I’m on board with you on what to do instead, but at that point it becomes business, too much of a real world and your craft pains. Nonetheless solving a business need or a problem is an integral part of design job. When given an hour of free time, would you rather spend it researching or crafting? It would be like telling a blogger he cannot write a post about unsolicited design, because someone has written a book — hint hint.
